alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 11:24AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hot Springs and northwestern Washakie Counties through 1145 AM MDT... At 1121 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Legend Rock State Petroglyph Site, or 20 miles southeast of Meeteetse, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. Small hail may briefly cover the ground under the core of the storm. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may briefly accumulate on roadways. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Hot Springs and northwestern Washakie Counties, including the following locations... Badlands Overlook and Grass Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief heavy rain may occur with this storm.

area.areaDesc: Cody Foothills; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
